page.title: 02A419 - THE OLD AND NEW ROAD
page.content: The A419 runs from Stroud to Stonehouse and also feeds the M.5. It carries heavy local traffic as well as a great deal of motorway traffic.It is a narrow bendy road that passes through Ebley Village with its several listed buildings.The heavy traffic is noisy,smelly,dangerous and damages the buildings which border the road. Mrs.D.Tucker,the secretary of the Ebley Village Bypass Action Group,said that the last traffic count showed that it was the busiest road in the county except for the motorway. A new road is to be started in April 1988.This will be to the south of the present road and canal along the route of the disused railway line. The old road will remain and hopefully Ebley will become a quiet friendly village again.
